activities.title: Peek-a-boo with a blanket
activities.description: Hide behind a blanket and pop out saying 'peek-a-boo!' Your little one will giggle with delight every time!
activities.benefits: Develops object permanence, social skills, and cause-and-effect understanding
activities.prep: Just grab any blanket or towel. Always remove blanket immediately after play.

activities.title: Sensory bottles
activities.description: Fill empty water bottles with colorful beads, glitter, and water. Seal tightly with glue and let your baby shake, roll, and explore the mesmerizing movement!
activities.benefits: Stimulates visual tracking, sensory processing, and focus
activities.prep: Collect clear plastic bottles, small colorful items (larger than toilet paper tube), and glue for sealing. Glue lid securely shut.

activities.title: Stacking cups
activities.description: Build colorful towers together and cheer when your baby knocks them down! Repeat for endless fun and learning.
activities.benefits: Develops hand-eye coordination, spatial awareness, and cause-effect understanding
activities.prep: Gather plastic stacking cups (common baby toy). Ensure cups are large enough to prevent choking.

activities.title: Blanket ride
activities.description: Gently pull your child around the room on a soft blanket while making 'vroom' sounds. Watch their delight as they glide along!
activities.benefits: Builds balance, core strength, and vestibular stimulation
activities.prep: Find a smooth floor and medium-sized blanket. Only pull on smooth surfaces with no obstacles.

activities.title: Texture exploration
activities.description: Guide baby's hands over different fabrics like silk, wool, and velvet while describing each texture. Watch their curiosity grow!
activities.benefits: Enhances tactile sensitivity, vocabulary, and sensory processing
activities.prep: Collect fabric swatches with varied textures. Fabrics must be clean and free of loose threads.

activities.title: Bubble chasing
activities.description: Blow streams of bubbles and encourage your toddler to chase and pop them. Celebrate each successful pop with cheers!
activities.benefits: Develops visual tracking, gross motor skills, and coordination
activities.prep: Prepare non-toxic bubble solution and wand.

activities.title: Rolling ball
activities.description: Sit facing your child and roll a soft ball back and forth. Clap and cheer each time they push it toward you!
activities.benefits: Builds hand-eye coordination, turn-taking skills, and object tracking
activities.prep: Find a soft, lightweight ball (minimum 1.75" diameter).

activities.title: Nature walk
activities.description: Carry your baby and point out leaves, flowers, and insects. Describe colors, shapes, and movements in an excited voice!
activities.benefits: Introduces natural world concepts, builds vocabulary, and stimulates senses
activities.prep: Find a safe outdoor path. Avoid poisonous plants; keep baby away from berries/flowers.

activities.title: Dance party
activities.description: Hold baby close and sway, bounce, and spin to upbeat music. Add gentle lifts for extra giggles!
activities.benefits: Develops rhythm awareness, balance, and bonding through movement
activities.prep: Choose fun, age-appropriate music. Support baby's neck; avoid excessive spinning.

activities.title: Mirror play
activities.description: Make funny faces and sounds in front of a mirror with your baby. Point to reflections while naming body parts!
activities.benefits: Builds self-recognition, social smiling, and facial expression awareness
activities.prep: Find a safe, baby-accessible unbreakable acrylic mirror.

activities.title: Soft toy parade
activities.description: March stuffed animals across furniture while making funny voices and sounds. Let baby touch and hold each 'parade member'!
activities.benefits: Encourages imaginative play, language development, and fine motor skills
activities.prep: Gather 3-5 stuffed animals with embroidered eyes (not plastic).

activities.title: Body parts song
activities.description: Sing 'Head, Shoulders, Knees and Toes' while touching each part on baby's body. Go slowly and add tickles!
activities.benefits: Teaches body awareness, vocabulary, and following simple instructions
activities.prep: Learn the song lyrics and motions. Be gentle with tickling; stop if baby shows discomfort.

activities.title: Kitchen drum set
activities.description: Let your baby bang pots and pans with wooden spoons. Show different rhythms and celebrate their musical creations!
activities.benefits: Develops cause-effect understanding, rhythm exploration, and motor skills
activities.prep: Gather unbreakable pots, pans, and spoons. Remove any pots with sharp edges.

activities.title: Cloud watching
activities.description: Lie together on a blanket and point out cloud shapes. Create stories about animals and objects you discover!
activities.benefits: Encourages imagination, visual perception, and language skills
activities.prep: Choose a clear day with visible clouds. Use sunscreen and hat for sun protection.

activities.title: Airplane baby
activities.description: Lift baby overhead while making engine noises. Gently 'fly' them around the room with dips and turns!
activities.benefits: Builds trust, spatial awareness, and core strength
activities.prep: Ensure clear space overhead. Always support head/neck; avoid after feeding.

activities.title: Tickle game
activities.description: Gently tickle different body parts while naming them. Pause dramatically between tickles for anticipation giggles!
activities.benefits: Teaches body part names, builds anticipation skills, and social bonding
activities.prep: None needed. Stop immediately if baby shows distress.

activities.title: Animal sounds
activities.description: Make exaggerated animal noises and encourage baby to mimic. Add matching animal actions like hopping or flapping!
activities.benefits: Develops auditory discrimination, imitation skills, and vocabulary
activities.prep: Think of 4-5 common animals and their sounds. Avoid loud sudden noises near ears.

activities.title: Kissing game
activities.description: Gently kiss baby's hands, feet, and nose while naming each. Finish with a big cuddle!
activities.benefits: Strengthens bonding, teaches body part names, and provides sensory input
activities.prep: None needed. Avoid kissing when tired.

activities.title: Baby massage
activities.description: Gently massage baby with lotion using long strokes. Describe what you're doing ('Now I'm rubbing your back!')
activities.benefits: Promotes relaxation, body awareness, and sensory integration
activities.prep: Use baby-safe lotion and warm hands. Patch test lotion first; avoid face.

activities.title: Lap bounce
activities.description: Sit baby on your lap and bounce rhythmically to nursery rhymes. Add gentle dips and leans for excitement!
activities.benefits: Develops balance, rhythm awareness, and vestibular stimulation
activities.prep: Learn simple bounce rhymes. Support baby's back/neck.

activities.title: Garden explorer
activities.description: Guide baby's hands to touch safe plants while describing textures ('This leaf is bumpy!'). Smell flowers together!
activities.benefits: Introduces nature concepts, sensory exploration, and descriptive language
activities.prep: Identify safe plants in your garden/park. Avoid toxic plants; wash hands after.

activities.title: Pat-a-cake
activities.description: Clap baby's hands together while singing. Add knee bounces and finish with a big hug on 'throw it in the oven'!
activities.benefits: Develops rhythm, social interaction, and motor coordination
activities.prep: Learn the hand motions for the rhyme. Be gentle with hand movements.

activities.title: Sock puppet show
activities.description: Use clean socks as puppets to act out simple stories. Make different voices and encourage baby to touch the 'characters'!
activities.benefits: Stimulates imagination, language development, and social interaction
activities.prep: Find 2-3 clean socks and draw simple faces with non-toxic markers.

activities.title: This little piggy
activities.description: Wiggle each toe while reciting the rhyme. Add tickles on 'wee wee wee all the way home'!
activities.benefits: Teaches body awareness, rhythm, and anticipation skills
activities.prep: None needed. Stop if baby pulls feet away.

activities.title: Baby yoga
activities.description: Gently move baby's arms and legs in simple stretches. Narrate actions ('Stretch up high! Now touch your toes!')
activities.benefits: Promotes flexibility, body awareness, and bonding through touch
activities.prep: Learn simple baby yoga poses. Never force movements; follow baby's range.

activities.title: Flying kisses
activities.description: Demonstrate blowing kisses and help baby mimic. Celebrate every attempt with cheers and claps!
activities.benefits: Develops imitation skills, social gestures, and bonding
activities.prep: None needed. Wash hands before.

activities.title: Nursery rhyme time
activities.description: Sing 'Twinkle Twinkle,' 'Itsy Bitsy Spider,' and 'Wheels on the Bus' with full motions and expressions!
activities.benefits: Builds language skills, memory, and motor coordination
activities.prep: Refresh lyrics and motions for 3 classics. Avoid overstimulation before bedtime.

activities.title: Up and down
activities.description: Lift baby high overhead, then slowly lower. Repeat with variations like spins or dips!
activities.benefits: Develops spatial awareness, vestibular stimulation, and trust
activities.prep: Ensure clear overhead space. Support head/neck; avoid after feeding.

activities.title: Baby sign language
activities.description: Teach simple signs like 'more,' 'milk,' and 'all done' during meals. Consistently sign while saying the words!
activities.benefits: Reduces frustration, builds communication skills, and cognitive understanding
activities.prep: Learn basic baby signs. Use simple, repetitive gestures.

activities.title: Stroller safari
activities.description: Narrate your walk like a nature documentary. Point out dogs, birds, and flowers with excitement!
activities.benefits: Builds observation skills, vocabulary, and environmental awareness
activities.prep: Plan a route with interesting sights. Secure baby properly in stroller.

activities.title: Color tour
activities.description: Carry baby around the room and name colors of objects you touch. 'This pillow is RED! Your shirt is BLUE!'
activities.benefits: Teaches color recognition, vocabulary, and object identification
activities.prep: None needed. Avoid small objects.

activities.title: Tummy time fun
activities.description: Place interesting toys just beyond reach during tummy time. Encourage reaching and celebrate efforts!
activities.benefits: Strengthens neck/back muscles, develops reaching skills, and builds persistence
activities.prep: Gather high-contrast toys. Supervise during tummy time.

activities.title: Baby book club
activities.description: Read board books with high-contrast pictures. Point to images, make sounds, and let baby turn pages!
activities.benefits: Builds early literacy skills, visual tracking, and attention span
activities.prep: Select 2-3 baby-friendly books. Use sturdy board books without small parts.

activities.title: Silly face contest
activities.description: Make exaggerated happy/surprised/silly faces. Encourage baby to mimic your expressions!
activities.benefits: Develops facial muscle control, imitation skills, and emotional recognition
activities.prep: None needed. Keep a gentle tone.

activities.title: Baby dance party
activities.description: Hold baby and dance to different music styles. Change movements with each song - salsa, rock, waltz!
activities.benefits: Develops rhythm, balance, and cultural sound awareness
activities.prep: Prepare playlist with varied musical styles. Support baby's neck and keep volume moderate.

activities.title: Where's baby?
activities.description: Drape a lightweight cloth over baby's head and ask 'Where's baby?' Pull it off with 'There you are!'
activities.benefits: Teaches object permanence, social anticipation, and peek-a-boo variation
activities.prep: Use a breathable cloth like muslin. Remove immediately after play and never leave unattended.

activities.title: Gentle baby exercises
activities.description: Help baby do 'bicycle legs' and arm crosses. Narrate motions ('Legs go round and round!')
activities.benefits: Promotes muscle development, joint flexibility, and body awareness
activities.prep: Ensure baby is on a soft surface. Never force movements.

activities.title: Magic scarf play
activities.description: Drape a lightweight scarf over baby and gently pull it away. Let baby grasp and explore the fabric!
activities.benefits: Develops object permanence, tactile exploration, and visual tracking
activities.prep: Use a sheer, lightweight scarf. Remove immediately after play and never leave unattended.

activities.title: Baby drumroll
activities.description: Gently 'drum' on baby's tummy while making escalating sounds. Finish with a tummy raspberry!
activities.benefits: Builds anticipation skills, body awareness, and cause-effect understanding
activities.prep: None needed. Avoid after feeding; be gentle.

activities.title: Park bench people watching
activities.description: Describe park activities to baby ('See the boy running? Hear the dog barking?')
activities.benefits: Builds observation skills, social awareness, and vocabulary
activities.prep: Find a busy park bench. Maintain safe distance from strangers.

activities.title: Container play
activities.description: Provide different sized containers for filling and emptying with safe objects. Demonstrate dumping and refilling!
activities.benefits: Teaches object permanence, size concepts, and hand-eye coordination
activities.prep: Gather plastic containers and toys larger than toilet paper tube. All items must be too large to choke on.

activities.title: Scarf peekaboo
activities.description: Play peekaboo using a lightweight scarf. Drape it over your head or baby's head for surprises!
activities.benefits: Develops object permanence, social anticipation, and fine motor skills
activities.prep: Use a sheer, breathable scarf. Remove immediately after play and never leave unattended.

activities.title: Texture walk
activities.description: Help baby walk barefoot on different surfaces (carpet, tile, foam mat). Describe each feeling!
activities.benefits: Stimulates tactile senses, builds walking confidence, and vocabulary
activities.prep: Create a safe path with varied surfaces. Clear path of hazards; supervise closely.

activities.title: Stroller safari
activities.description: Point out vehicles, animals, and nature during your walk. Use exciting narration like a tour guide!
activities.benefits: Builds environmental awareness, vocabulary, and observation skills
activities.prep: Plan a route with diverse sights. Secure baby properly in stroller.

activities.title: Baby book club
activities.description: Read high-contrast board books together. Point to pictures and ask simple questions ('Where's the dog?')
activities.benefits: Develops early literacy, visual tracking, and object identification
activities.prep: Choose books with bold illustrations. Use sturdy board books without small parts.

activities.title: Silly face contest
activities.description: Make exaggerated expressions and sounds. Reward baby's imitation attempts with cheers and claps!
activities.benefits: Encourages facial muscle development, emotional recognition, and imitation skills
activities.prep: None needed. Keep a gentle tone.

activities.title: Baby dance party
activities.description: Move to different musical styles! Sway to lullabies, bounce to pop, and wiggle to jazz with baby in arms.
activities.benefits: Develops rhythm awareness, bonding through movement, and cultural sound exposure
activities.prep: Prepare playlist with diverse music. Support baby's neck and keep volume moderate.

activities.title: Where's baby?
activities.description: Play peek-a-boo using a burp cloth. Cover your face or baby's face for short surprises!
activities.benefits: Reinforces object permanence, social anticipation, and visual tracking
activities.prep: Use a small cloth or burp rag. Remove immediately after play.

activities.title: Flying kisses
activities.description: Blow exaggerated kisses to baby and help them mimic. Celebrate every attempt like it's a major achievement!
activities.benefits: Develops imitation skills, social-emotional connection, and fine motor control
activities.prep: None needed. Wash hands before.

activities.title: Nursery rhyme time
activities.description: Sing 'Row Your Boat,' 'Hickory Dickory Dock,' and 'Baa Baa Black Sheep' with full motions and enthusiasm!
activities.benefits: Builds language patterns, memory skills, and parent-child bonding
activities.prep: Refresh lyrics for 3 nursery rhymes. Avoid overstimulation before bedtime.

activities.title: Up and down
activities.description: Lift baby high while saying 'UP!', then lower while saying 'DOWN!' Add spins and dips for variation!
activities.benefits: Develops spatial awareness, vestibular stimulation, and understanding of opposites
activities.prep: Ensure clear space above. Support head/neck; avoid after feeding.

activities.title: Baby drumroll
activities.description: Gently drum on baby's tummy while making escalating sounds. Finish with a tickle flourish!
activities.benefits: Builds anticipation skills, body awareness, and cause-effect understanding
activities.prep: None needed. Avoid after feeding; be gentle.

activities.title: Garden explorer
activities.description: Guide baby to touch safe plants while describing textures. Smell flowers together and listen for birds!
activities.benefits: Introduces nature concepts, sensory exploration, and descriptive language
activities.prep: Identify baby-safe plants. Avoid toxic plants; wash hands after.

activities.title: Water Splash Tray
activities.description: Place baby in high chair with a shallow tray of water and floating toys. Let them splash and explore water properties with supervision.
activities.benefits: Develops tactile sensitivity, cause-effect understanding, and motor planning
activities.prep: Use spill-proof tray and small amount of water (≤1 inch). Never leave unattended.

activities.title: Crinkle Sensory Bottle
activities.description: Seal colorful fabrics and crinkle materials inside a clear plastic bottle for baby to shake and explore safely.
activities.benefits: Stimulates auditory/tactile senses and encourages independent exploration
activities.prep: Glue lid permanently shut after filling. Ensure items inside are too large to choke on.

activities.title: Floating Ball Play
activities.description: Gently bat a lightweight fabric ball back and forth while lying on your backs, keeping it floating above you.
activities.benefits: Develops visual tracking, coordination, and neck strength
activities.prep: Use ball larger than baby's mouth to prevent choking.

activities.title: Sensory Footpath
activities.description: Create a textured path with different materials (towel, bubble wrap, foam) for baby to crawl or walk over barefoot.
activities.benefits: Enhances tactile processing, balance, and body awareness
activities.prep: Secure materials to floor with tape to prevent slipping.

activities.title: Flashlight Shadows
activities.description: In a dim room, make hand shadows on walls using a flashlight. Let baby chase the light patterns.
activities.benefits: Develops visual tracking, focus, and spatial awareness
activities.prep: Dim room slightly. Never shine light directly in eyes.

activities.title: Edible Finger Paint
activities.description: Make taste-safe paints from yogurt and natural food coloring. Let baby create masterpieces on high chair trays.
activities.benefits: Encourages creativity, color recognition, and fine motor skills
activities.prep: Mix colors in ice cube tray. Check for dairy allergies; use only edible ingredients.

activities.title: Laundry Basket Rides
activities.description: Push baby around in a sturdy laundry basket, making vehicle sounds and gentle stops/starts.
activities.benefits: Develops balance, spatial orientation, and vestibular stimulation
activities.prep: Only on smooth surfaces; avoid tipping. Supervise closely.

activities.title: Sound Matching Game
activities.description: Shake identical containers filled with different materials (rice, beans, bells) and help baby find matching pairs.
activities.benefits: Develops auditory discrimination, memory, and concentration
activities.prep: Prepare matching sound sets with containers permanently sealed.

activities.title: Ramp Rolling
activities.description: Roll balls and toy cars down a makeshift ramp (propped board) and cheer when baby retrieves them.
activities.benefits: Teaches gravity concepts, cause-effect relationships, and crawling motivation
activities.prep: Create stable incline surface. Toys must be too large to choke on.

activities.title: Contact Paper Collage
activities.description: Stick contact paper sticky-side-up and let baby attach lightweight objects (feathers, fabric scraps).
activities.benefits: Develops fine motor skills, sensory processing, and creativity
activities.prep: Tape contact paper to table. Use objects larger than toilet paper tube.

activities.title: Pillow Mountain Climb
activities.description: Create a soft obstacle course using couch cushions and pillows. Help baby crawl over and explore the different levels.
activities.benefits: Develops gross motor skills, spatial awareness, and risk assessment
activities.prep: Clear floor space, ensure no hard edges. Keep height low; supervise closely.

activities.title: Shaker Bottle Band
activities.description: Fill small plastic bottles with different materials (rice, pasta, bells) and secure lids with glue. Shake to create a musical ensemble!
activities.benefits: Develops auditory discrimination, rhythm skills, and cause-effect understanding
activities.prep: Glue lids securely and permanently shut after filling.

activities.title: Fabric Tunnel Crawl
activities.description: Drape blankets between furniture to create a crawl tunnel. Cheer as baby navigates through the fabric pathway!
activities.benefits: Encourages crawling, spatial reasoning, and confidence
activities.prep: Ensure secure setup and clear floor space. Keep tunnel short; supervise closely.

activities.title: Velcro Block Tower
activities.description: Use soft blocks with Velcro surfaces to build towers that stick together. Celebrate when baby pulls them apart!
activities.benefits: Develops fine motor skills, cause-effect understanding, and persistence
activities.prep: Purchase baby-safe velcro blocks. Blocks must be large enough to prevent choking.

activities.title: Nature Sensory Tray
activities.description: Place safe natural items (large pinecones, leaves, smooth stones) in a tray for baby to explore textures.
activities.benefits: Teaches natural textures, sensory processing, and descriptive language
activities.prep: Collect items >3 inches; wash thoroughly. Avoid toxic plants.

activities.title: Follow the Light
activities.description: Move a flashlight beam slowly across walls and floors. Encourage baby to track the light with eyes or crawling.
activities.benefits: Develops visual tracking, focus, and crawling motivation
activities.prep: Dim room slightly. Never shine directly in eyes.

activities.title: Sock Ball Toss
activities.description: Roll soft socks into balls. Practice tossing them into a laundry basket from short distances.
activities.benefits: Develops hand-eye coordination, throwing skills, and persistence
activities.prep: Use clean socks without small decorations. Roll tightly into balls.

activities.title: Texture Ball Pass
activities.description: Roll different textured balls (knobby, smooth, bumpy) back and forth. Describe each texture as you play.
activities.benefits: Enhances tactile sensitivity, turn-taking skills, and descriptive vocabulary
activities.prep: Collect 3-4 differently textured balls >1.75" diameter.

activities.title: Fabric Pull Box
activities.description: Place large fabric squares in a container with a hole. Let baby pull them out through the opening.
activities.benefits: Develops fine motor skills, object permanence, and cause-effect understanding
activities.prep: Cut opening wide enough for small hands; fabrics >6x6 inches.

activities.title: Bubble Wrap Stomp
activities.description: Tape bubble wrap to the floor. Hold baby as they stomp to make satisfying popping sounds!
activities.benefits: Develops balance, cause-effect understanding, and auditory processing
activities.prep: Secure bubble wrap firmly to floor with tape. Supervise closely.

activities.title: Floating Boats
activities.description: Float plastic lids or sponges in water tray. Show baby how to make 'boats' move by blowing or pushing.
activities.benefits: Teaches floating concepts, cause-effect relationships, and breath control
activities.prep: Use ≤1 inch of water with constant supervision.

activities.title: Sponge Painting
activities.description: Use colorful sponges dipped in non-toxic paint to create art on paper. No choking hazards!
activities.benefits: Develops color mixing concepts, creativity, and fine motor skills
activities.prep: Cut sponges into large shapes (>3 inches). Use only non-toxic paint.

activities.title: Rainstick Serenade
activities.description: Make DIY rainsticks from sealed tubes filled with rice. Tilt slowly to create soothing rainfall sounds.
activities.benefits: Calms sensory overload, develops auditory tracking, and cause-effect understanding
activities.prep: Seal ends permanently with tape to prevent access to contents.

activities.title: Falling Leaves
activities.description: Gently drop large fabric leaves from height. Encourage baby to catch them or watch them float downward.
activities.benefits: Develops visual tracking, grasping skills, and understanding of gravity
activities.prep: Use fabric leaves >4 inches to prevent choking.

activities.title: Shadow Puppet Show
activities.description: Make simple animal shapes with hands in flashlight beam. Narrate stories about the shadow creatures.
activities.benefits: Stimulates imagination, visual focus, and language development
activities.prep: Practice basic shadow animals. Never shine directly in eyes.

activities.title: Sensory Ribbon Ring
activities.description: Attach colorful ribbons to a plastic ring. Let baby wave, pull, and explore the flowing textures.
activities.benefits: Develops visual tracking, grasping skills, and cause-effect understanding
activities.prep: Securely tie ribbons to ring. Ribbons must be short (4-6") to prevent wrapping.

activities.title: Muffin Tin Sorting
activities.description: Place large pom-poms in a muffin tin. Show baby how to transfer them between compartments.
activities.benefits: Develops fine motor skills, color recognition, and sorting concepts
activities.prep: Ensure pom-poms are too large to swallow (>2 inches).

activities.title: Mirror Dancing
activities.description: Hold baby facing a mirror while dancing. Point to reflections and make movements together.
activities.benefits: Develops self-recognition, coordination, and bonding
activities.prep: Secure unbreakable acrylic mirror to wall or use floor mirror.

activities.title: Bean Bag Balance
activities.description: Place soft bean bags on baby's head, hands, or feet while they sit. Cheer when they stay balanced!
activities.benefits: Develops body awareness, balance, and concentration
activities.prep: Use lightweight bags with securely sealed filling.

activities.title: Cardboard Box Car
activities.description: Decorate a large box as a vehicle. Push baby around while making engine sounds.
activities.benefits: Stimulates imagination, spatial awareness, and social interaction
activities.prep: Cut safe entry/exit points. Avoid small decorations; supervise closely.

activities.title: Sensory Glove
activities.description: Attach different textures (fabric, foil, fur) to glove fingers. Let baby touch each texture during diaper changes.
activities.benefits: Develops tactile discrimination and focus during routines
activities.prep: Securely glue textures to glove. Ensure fabrics cannot detach.

activities.title: Bubble Wrap Painting
activities.description: Dip bubble wrap in washable paint. Help baby press it onto paper to create textured prints.
activities.benefits: Develops cause-effect understanding, sensory processing, and creativity
activities.prep: Use non-toxic paint outdoors for easy cleanup. Supervise closely.

activities.title: Ball Pit Ball Race
activities.description: Blow large plastic balls across a table using straws. Race to the edge!
activities.benefits: Develops oral motor skills, breath control, and cause-effect understanding
activities.prep: Supervise straw use closely. Balls must be >2 inches to prevent choking.

activities.title: Felt Board Stories
activities.description: Create simple felt shapes to stick on a felt board. Tell stories while baby places pieces.
activities.benefits: Develops storytelling skills, fine motor control, and creativity
activities.prep: Cut large, simple shapes (sun, tree, house) >3 inches.

activities.title: Indoor "Snowball" Fight
activities.description: Crumple white paper into large balls. Gently toss them at each other while sitting.
activities.benefits: Develops gross motor skills, social reciprocity, and sensory processing
activities.prep: Use soft paper without sharp edges. Balls must be large; avoid face.

activities.title: Sensory Gel Bags
activities.description: Fill sealable bags with hair gel and large glitter. Tape securely to high chair tray.
activities.benefits: Develops tactile exploration and visual tracking without mess
activities.prep: Double-bag and duct tape all openings permanently.

activities.title: Parachute Play
activities.description: Use a bedsheet as a mini parachute. Gently lift and lower while baby sits underneath.
activities.benefits: Develops visual tracking, social interaction, and cause-effect understanding
activities.prep: Clear space, keep fabric away from face. Supervise closely.

activities.title: Texture Ball Painting
activities.description: Roll large balls dipped in paint across paper in a shallow box.
activities.benefits: Develops cause-effect understanding, color recognition, and sensory integration
activities.prep: Use non-toxic paint. Balls must be larger than child's mouth.

activities.title: Sock Hand Puppets
activities.description: Draw faces on clean socks. Animate simple conversations between characters.
activities.benefits: Develops language skills, social-emotional awareness, and imagination
activities.prep: Use non-toxic markers for simple faces.

activities.title: Frozen Toy Rescue
activities.description: Freeze large toys in ice. Let baby explore melting with warm water and tools.
activities.benefits: Teaches temperature concepts, problem-solving, and patience
activities.prep: Freeze large toys only (>3 inches). Constant supervision required.

activities.title: Rainbow Ribbon Wands
activities.description: Attach ribbons to short dowels. Wave to create colorful patterns in the air.
activities.benefits: Develops visual tracking, gross motor skills, and color recognition
activities.prep: Secure ribbons firmly. Ribbons must be short (6") to prevent wrapping.

activities.title: Sensory Balance Beam
activities.description: Create a ground-level beam with masking tape. Help baby walk along the line.
activities.benefits: Develops balance, coordination, and body awareness
activities.prep: Make straight or curved paths on floor. Clear area of obstacles.

activities.title: Magnetic Fishing
activities.description: Use a magnetic wand to 'catch' large foam shapes with embedded magnets in a bin.
activities.benefits: Develops hand-eye coordination, fine motor skills, and STEM concepts
activities.prep: Ensure magnets are securely embedded and cannot detach.

activities.title: Musical Instrument Exploration
activities.description: Introduce simple instruments (maraca, drum, xylophone). Explore sounds together.
activities.benefits: Develops auditory discrimination, rhythm awareness, and cause-effect
activities.prep: Choose instruments with no small parts.

activities.title: Flashlight Tag
activities.description: Shine flashlight on walls and ceiling. Encourage baby to touch the light spots.
activities.benefits: Develops visual tracking, crawling/walking motivation, and focus
activities.prep: Dim room. Never shine directly in eyes.

activities.title: Colorful Sponge Stack
activities.description: Cut sponges into large blocks. Build towers in water or on dry land.
activities.benefits: Develops stacking skills, color recognition, and sensory exploration
activities.prep: Cut sponges into 3"+ cubes to prevent choking.

activities.title: Family Photo "Reading"
activities.description: Look at photos of family members together. Name each person and tell simple stories.
activities.benefits: Builds family bonds, object recognition, and early literacy skills
activities.prep: Create simple board book with family photos. Use sturdy book without small parts.
